intro: Rubus pyrenaicus, commonly known as the Pyrenean bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the Pyrenees mountain range, spanning parts of France, Spain, and Portugal. The plant is a shrub with thorny stems and compound leaves, typically growing in rocky or forested areas. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and appear in clusters, followed by red or black berries. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
